quest.name: By the Muse Forsaken
journal:
Managingway would have you assist an artist struggling to find their Way.

※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
Search for the muttering Loporrit in Greatest Endsvale.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: Some of our artists have been so prolific in their painting that they now claim to lack sufficient inspiration.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: One Way in particular has become quite disheartened─so much so that they have taken to conversing with the very nothingness that plagues them. To be frank, I'm more than somewhat concerned.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: I do hate to trouble you with such a gloomy affair, but could you perhaps offer them some encouragement? You should find them wandering Greatest Endsvale and muttering sad words.

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: Sad words... Sad words...

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: Aaah! Y-You frightened me. Have you come to hear of my emptiness?

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: With these two paws, I have depicted my entire existence. The moon. The Loporrits. The...well, that's about it, really. I have painted everything and now nothing seems new or interesting. Oh, whatever is left for me...?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: How about painting Etheirys?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You could try drawing a person.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Bunnies. Lots and lots of bunnies.

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: Etheirys? But so many Ways have already painted it. A bright, blue orb suspended in unending darkness...

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: But wait! If I were to draw the landscapes that may or may not exist upon Etheirys...that could be very lovely!

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: A person? If you only knew how many Ways have drawn the people who were meant to join us...the people who never came...

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: But wait! If I were to draw a Loporrit as a person...that could be something remarkable!

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: Bunnies? What are those?

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: Etheirys has Loporrits!? Why haven't I heard of this!? I must draw them straightaway!

dialogue.name: LOPORRIT04711
dialogue.text: I feel alive again─inspired! I didn't think it possible. Thank you, Forename. And thanks to Managingway for sending you!

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: Right on schedule! Our muttering friend has gotten straight to work at the imaging station, and I managed to sneak a glance at their progress.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: I do believe they are recreating images from Etheirys. Regardless of accuracy, the awe they hold for Mother Hydaelyn's star is palpable in their work.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: It is...unique to say the least. “Terrifying,” may be a more accurate word. A beast of neither man nor Loporrit, grinning eerily from the confines of a dark prison...? Ahem.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: I do believe they are drawing what you would call a “bunny.” While anatomically questionable, their work exhibits a tangible curiosity and excitement regarding the creatures.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: At the end of the day, the priority of art is its creation, not its analysis. So long as our Way remains bright and bushy-tailed, I am quite satisfied.

dialogue.name: MANAGINGWAY
dialogue.text: Still, the flow of inspiration is known to be fickle, so I may call upon you again should our Ways require it. Until next time.
